name: The Breakfast Club
description: We’re excited to invite you to an exclusive breakfast and coffee preview of Muro Café, where Bangalore will experience the best of Asian breakfast and a celebration of Single Origin Coffees of Karnataka’s finest coffee estates. Join us on every Saturday & Sunday for our Asian breakfast menu.From 9 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., experience Muro Cafe's unique twist on breakfast; from rich Crab Omelettes and indulgent Hong Kong French Toast to creamy Basque Cheesecake & more.Celebrate food, community, and the joy of coming together. Muro: https://www.instagram.com/murocafeblr/

location.address: 5, Museum Rd, next to Toscano Restaurant, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: Smash Guys Burger Residency with Beer
description: Smash Guys Burger Residency with BeerThe Smash Guys Burger Residency with Beer marks a thrilling new chapter for The Conservatory, a space that has become a hotspot for culinary innovation over the past two years. We've hosted some of the country’s most exciting chefs and restaurants, recently venturing into international collaborations that have elevated Bengaluru’s dining scene.Now, we’re taking it one step further by introducing a unique residency experience—and who better to kick it off than the Smash Guys? With their expertly crafted burgers and a mission to redefine the city’s burger game, this month-long residency promises to be a delicious adventure you won’t want to miss.Smash Guys is the latest creation from Nikhil and AB Gupta, the culinary masterminds behind The Pizza Bakery and Paris Panini. This time, their mission is bold: to celebrate the art of the burger by bringing the finest styles from across the globe under one roof.After months of meticulously crafting every bite since their smash hit debut at The Conservatory, they’re now ready to take things up a notch with an exciting month-long residency.Smash Guys is here to redefine Bengaluru’s burger scene, filling the flavor void with juicy patties, crisp buns, and creative combinations that promise to thrill every burger lover in town.The dream team behind Smash Guys: Chef Guru is the Chef Partner at The Pizza Bakery & Paris Panini. Graduated from Le Cordon Bleu, Australia, his expertise in balancing textures and creating unique sauce combinations brings an unexpected twist to classic burger elements. His commitment to sourcing premium ingredients ensures every component tells its own story while contributing to a harmonious whole.Chef Adithya Kidambi is our friendly neighborhood kombucha scientist. He has built mossant into the best craft kombucha brand in the city, but what few know about him is that he is a trained Chef and self-taught burger scholar who delivered burgers to people during the lockdown post which he sold out at several pop-ups in the city. Adi excels in styles like the Nashville Chicken, Smash Buff/Lamb classics, and Asian-inspired burgers using ingredients like kimchi and miso.Chef Suby is all about chasing the ULTIMATE BURGER DREAM. His obsession with achieving the perfect meat-to-fat ratio and that caramelised crust has led him to experiment with countless grinds and smashing techniques. Chef Rohil brings an elegant touch to the veg side of our menu. He completes our trio with his innovative approach to flavour building, and fine-tuning the perfect balance of flavour and texture.Beer on TapTo make this residency even better, The Conservatory will be serving up refreshing beer on tap throughout the month. Pair your favorite Smash Guys burger with a perfectly chilled pint, and let the ultimate burger-and-beer experience begin!The Burger MenuNon- Vegetarian MenuBUFFALO FRIED CHICKEN (Rs. 585)buffalo sauce dunked fried chicken, grilled onions, blue cheese sauce, lettuce CRISPY CHICKEN DIPPER  (Rs.585)french dip dunked fried chicken, white onions, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuce. Served with a french gravy dip GRILLED TERIYAKI (Rs.585)teriyaki sauce dunked grilled chicken, togarashi flakes, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuce FOSTER CHICKEN SMASH (Rs.585)double smash chicken patty, cheese slice, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuce OKLAHOMA ONION SMASH (BUFF/ LAMB) (Rs.650)double onion-smash patties, chimichurri, american cheese, pickles, smash sauce, lettuce CHILLI CHEESE SMASH  (BUFF/ LAMB) (Rs.650)double smash patties, american cheese, smash sauce, home-made chilli sofrito, chilli cheese BACON PEANUT BUTTER SMASH (Rs.689)single smash buff patty, american cheese, crispy bacon, crunchy peanut butter, sliced red paprika, smash sauce 8 HR. BRAISED BRISKET (Rs.689)single pickled-onion smash buff patty, double cheese, 8 hrs braised bbq brisket, smash sauce THE DALSTON DIP  (Rs.715)double buff smash patties, double cheese, grilled onions, smash sauce. Served with a home-made jus THE FLINTSTONE (Rs.715)single smash buff patty, american cheese, crispy bacon, torched bone marrow, pickles, smash sauce DIANE SMASH  (Rs.735)double buff smash patties, double cheese, diane sauce, grilled onions, smash sauce THE WELLINGTON  (Rs.735)double mustard-buff smash patties, crispy bacon, roasted mushroom, smash sauce. Served with a home-made jus Vegetarian MenuOYSTER MUSHROOM KARAAGE  (Rs. 520)fried oyster mushroom, togarashi flakes, pickles, truffle aioli, truffle oil, lettuce KOREAN FRIED PANEER (Rs. 598)gochujang glazed paneer, slaw, scallion relish, garlic aioli, lettuce BROCCOLI & CHEDDAR (Rs. 540)crumbed broccoli, cheddar & walnut patty, american cheese, jalapeño, smash sauce, lettuce BLACK BEAN (Rs. 520)crumbed black bean patty, cheese slice, chimichurri, white onions, pickles, smash sauce, lettuce SidesTRUFFLE FRIES (Rs.390)truffle aioli, parmesan, parsley SAUCY DIANE FRIES  (Rs.415)diane sauce (contains buff), bacon, smash sauce, parmesan, parsley DessertDEEP FRIED OREOS  (Rs.390)pancake-batter-dunked oreos, whipped custard, dulce de leche OLD MONK CHOCO MOUSSE (Rs.390)whipped custard, cocoa dust ﻿Terms and Conditions :Please note, INR 1000 from the ticket price is redeemable against the food and beverage menuGuests must be of a legal drinking age to consume alcohol at the eventKindly ensure you arrive promptly for your designated slot.The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.We cannot accommodate more than 8 people on a table.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The menu is subject to adjustments/ changes at the discretion of the chefs.Please note, tickets once booked cannot be shifted to another datePhotographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: A window into Kalaripayatt - Robin Philip
description: Step Into the World of Kalaripayatt with Urban KalariExperience the ancient wisdom of Kalaripayattu through a modern lens in this 2-day beginner-friendly workshop, A Window into Kalaripayatt. Guided by Robin Philip—an expert with over a decade of training under esteemed Gurukkals—this program breaks down the essence of this martial art into a relatable, accessible format.Workshop Highlights:Foundational Movements: Master basic stances, leg raises, jumps, and sequences.Self-Defense Reflexes: Learn six essential blocks to build muscle memory and confidence.Precision and Form: Avoid common errors and engage correctly for maximum impact.Flow and Connection: Practice two full-body flows for a seamless integration of movement.Kalari Philosophy: Discover the principles of Kalaripayattu and Kalari Chikilsa for a deeper mind-body connection.Who Should Join?This workshop is perfect for anyone curious about Kalari, seeking a holistic workout, exploring animal-inspired movement, or looking for practical self-defense skills. Whether you’re reconnecting with movement or starting fresh, this is your gateway to the profound art of Kalaripayattu.Rediscover the balance of strength, agility, and mindfulness. Join us and take the first step into this transformative journey!

name: Korean Shop with Chef Gokul
description: We’re ringing in the new year with a Korean Shop by Chef Gokul!This new year, we invite you to explore the rich, vibrant flavors of Korean cuisine at The Conservatory with Korean Shop by Chef Gokul. This special menu is a tribute to the late-night culinary adventures Chef Gokul experienced in New York’s Koreatown, but with a personal twist—he was first introduced to Korean cooking by his Korean friend’s mother and grandmother, whose home-cooked meals left a mark on his culinary journey.Chef Gokul, a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, has perfected his craft at renowned Michelin-starred restaurants such as Junoon, Aureole, The Clock Tower, Rezdora, and Dominique in New York, as well as Blackbird in Chicago. His expertise spans both culinary and pastry arts, and his innovative creations have taken Chennai by storm through his brand Hygge By Chef Gokul.From Italian to Korean, Japanese to Thai, Filipino to Ethiopian, Chef Gokul’s culinary expertise covers a world of flavors. His time in New York, shaped by the warmth of Korean home cooking, inspired him to bring the bold, comforting tastes of Korea to life in this pop-up.Korean Shop Menu - à la carteBanchan (Side Dishes)Tongbaechu Kimchi (Napa Cabbage Kimchi)Pa Kimchi (Spring Onion and Apple Kimchi)Oi Muchim (Cucumber Kimchi)Kakdugi (Korean Radish Kimchi)Gaji Namul (Eggplant Side Dish)Sigeumchi Namul (Soy Garlic Spinach)Small PlatesCheese Tteokbokki (V) 560Chewy Korean Rice Cakes, Spicy Jang Sauce, Melted Cheese, Scallions, Sesame SeedsPyeonsu (Cold Dumplings) (V) 420North Korean Specialty Dumplings, Vinegared Soy, Cold Clear Broth, Scallion OilGun Mandu 560Surf and Turf Dumplings, Pork, Shrimp, Napa Cabbage, Jang Soy DipNapjak Mandu (Daegu Specialty) (V) 560Flat Dumplings, Scallions, Glass Noodles, Chef’s Special Garu Chili Crisp, Soy, ScallionsYangneyeom Dak 560Sweet and Spicy Korean Fried ChickenBuldak 630Fiery Spicy Korean Fried ChickenLarge PlatesDak Kalguksu 980Knife-Cut Noodles, Marinated Chicken, Rich Chicken Broth, Soy Tare, Perilla Roasted Seaweed, Marinated Egg, Roasted Sesame Powder, ScallionsDolcet Bibimbap 1050Sizzling Stone Bowl with Crusted Crispy Rice, Bulgogi Beef/Buldak Chicken, Sautéed Vegetables and Seasoned Greens, Bellflower Root, Napa Kimchi, Sunny Side Egg, Chef’s Special Bibimbap SauceSanchae Bibimbap (V) 980Sizzling Stone Bowl with Crusted Crispy Rice, Sanchae (Seasonal Wild Vegetables), Sautéed Vegetables and Seasoned Greens, Bellflower Root, Napa Kimchi, Sunny Side Egg, Chef’s Special Bibimbap SauceBokkeum-bap (Junggukjip Bokkeum-Bap) (Contains Egg) 630Fried Rice Made with Scallion Infused Oil, Jajang Sauce, Eggs, Chef’s Special Garu Chili CrispBossam (with Jeyuk Bokkeum) 980Spicy Marinated Pork Belly, Steamed Rice, Lettuce, Ssamjang, Onion, Garlic, KimchiTofu Ssam (V) 910Spicy Tofu Bulgogi, Steamed Rice, Lettuce, Ssamjang, Onion, Garlic, KimchiTerms and Conditions: Please note, INR 1200 from the ticket price is redeemable against the food menuThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.The conservatory is located on the 2nd floor of the Courtyard which is a 44 step climb upPlease arrive on time for your selected slot, as your ticket is valid only for that specific time. Once purchased, your slot cannot be changed.Do not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.Each slot, lasting 2 hours only, requires attendance at the booked time, with no accommodation for attendance at any other slot except the one booked.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Children over 7 years of age require a ticket.Children below the age of 7 are not allowed.No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.

name: Korean Shop with Chef Gokul
description: We’re ringing in the new year with a Korean Shop by Chef Gokul!This new year, we invite you to explore the rich, vibrant flavors of Korean cuisine at The Conservatory with Korean Shop by Chef Gokul. This special menu is a tribute to the late-night culinary adventures Chef Gokul experienced in New York’s Koreatown, but with a personal twist—he was first introduced to Korean cooking by his Korean friend’s mother and grandmother, whose home-cooked meals left a mark on his culinary journey.Chef Gokul, a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, has perfected his craft at renowned Michelin-starred restaurants such as Junoon, Aureole, The Clock Tower, Rezdora, and Dominique in New York, as well as Blackbird in Chicago. His expertise spans both culinary and pastry arts, and his innovative creations have taken Chennai by storm through his brand Hygge By Chef Gokul.From Italian to Korean, Japanese to Thai, Filipino to Ethiopian, Chef Gokul’s culinary expertise covers a world of flavors. His time in New York, shaped by the warmth of Korean home cooking, inspired him to bring the bold, comforting tastes of Korea to life in this pop-up.Korean Shop Menu - à la carteBanchan (Side Dishes)Tongbaechu Kimchi (Napa Cabbage Kimchi)Pa Kimchi (Spring Onion and Apple Kimchi)Oi Muchim (Cucumber Kimchi)Kakdugi (Korean Radish Kimchi)Gaji Namul (Eggplant Side Dish)Sigeumchi Namul (Soy step climb upPlease arrive on time for your selected slot, as your ticket is valid only for that specific time. Once purchased, your slot cannot be changed.Do not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.Each slot, lasting 2 hours only, requires attendance at the booked time, with no accommodation for attendance at any other slot except the one booked.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Children over 7 years of age require a ticket.Children below the age of 7 are not allowed.No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.

name: A 2 Day Kalaripayattu Workshop
description: We are hosting a 2-day Live Kalaripayattu workshop on 11th & 12 Jan 2025 (Saturday & Sunday)We are bringing to you Specially curated exercises inspired from Kalaripayattu that can be practised at the comfort of your home.What's included in the Workshop:A 2 Day Live workshop provided by Experienced Kalaripayattu Teachers on 11th & 12 Jan 2025 each.There would be 1.5 hours of a Online session 1 week prior to the workshop to brief you about the workshop and to provide Theoretical Introduction to the Kalaripayattu movements and to address other question and answers.Post workshop , there would be 1.5 hours of Online Session 1 week later to clear your doubts and address other issues related.Support through whatsapp / Call in future.This workshop is open for both Adults and Kids. There movements would be different and according to the respective age groupsBenefits of attending this Workshop:Learn Scientific , Natural Kalaripayattu Movements as a fitness routine to include in your day to day Lifestyle (no equipments required)Improve Mental Focus & MindfulnessDevelop A Stronger, Healthier Spine

name: New Year Party- Catch The Groove. Release The Vibe
description: Step into a night of pure musical magic with Druid Garden’s Catch & Release NYE Party. Feel the thrill as beats meet your soul, creating unforgettable moments on the dance floor. No trends, no rules—just music that moves you. Join us for an evening of raw energy, electrifying vibes, and the joy of discovery. Let’s welcome the new year together, from 8 PM onwards, 31st December. Catch the feeling. Release the rest.

location.address: Century Corbel - Commercial, 40/1, Sahakara Nagar Main Rd, Sahakar Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560092, India

organizer.name: The Druid Garden
organizer.description: The Druid Garden offers a blend of elegance and creativity, featuring over 15 acclaimed global cuisines. Our chefs focus on authenticity, using only fresh, natural ingredients. Enjoy hand-crafted cocktails, unique brews, and an unforgettable dining experience that balances modernity with tradition.

name: Enjoy Ramen with Strangers
description: Bond Over Ramen! 🍜Ready to noodle your way into new connections?At the Enjoy Ramen with Strangers table, each bowl is packed with flavor and great conversations! It’s not just about the noodles (though they’re amazing! 😋); it’s about the conversations, the laughs, and the bonds you’ll form over a table with Strangers!Meet new people, share stories, and laugh over steaming bowl of ramen!✨

location.address: 197, Paramahansa Yogananda Rd, Binnamangala, Hoysala Nagar, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

organizer.name: HighTable
organizer.description: Meet a small group of strangers offline, with no agendas—just good conversations and genuine connections. Whether it’s a random thought or a deep dive, you never know where it might lead. Sometimes, the best connections happen when you least expect them.

name: Starting Fresh with Strangers
description: Kick off the new year with open hearts, clear minds and fresh connections!🌟This table is all about embracing new beginnings, fostering positive energy and meeting like-minded people who are ready to make 2025 their best year yet.Whether you're looking for meaningful conversations, new friendships, or simply a fresh perspective, this table offers a warm, welcoming space to connect, share and vibe.Let’s start the year with good vibes, new faces and the excitement of what's to come. No matter where you’re from or where you’re headed, we’re all starting fresh together!🎊

name: A JIVAMUKTI Yoga Backbends Workshop led by Ninya
description: “The Gateway to Backbends: Exploring the Psoas”A JIVAMUKTI Yoga Workshop led by Ninya LehrheuerThe psoas, often referred to as the “muscle of the soul,” plays a key role in connecting the spine, pelvis, and legs—bridging not just movement, but also memory and emotional experience stored in the body. This workshop explores how releasing tension in the psoas can free us from long-held patterns, both physical and mental, that stem from the past.Aligned with the Jivamukti Focus of the Month, “What’s Inside Memory,” we’ll reflect on how the body holds echoes of past experiences and explore how mindful psoas stretching and backbending can help dissolve those imprints. Through a combination of anatomical insight, guided movement, and breath work, you’ll learn how to stabilize and expand into heart-opening backbends that cultivate liberation and presence.Join us for this journey to discover what lies within the psoas—and how unlocking it can open the heart and release the memories that keep us tethered to the past.

name: Courtyard Kids Playdate with The LooRoo Club
description: Courtyard's monthly playdate with The LooRoo Club is back!Celebrate the joy of India’s harvest festivals with a magical playdate your kids will love! January marks the season of vibrant traditions like Makar Sankranti, Pongal, Lohri, and Bihu, and we’re bringing them to life in a fun, hands-on way.Here’s what’s in store:Paint Pongal potsDecorate colorful kitesDance to lively folk songsCreate stunning rangoli designsEnjoy festive treatsFor children aged 3 to 8 years, accompanied by a parent.Give your little ones a chance to explore art, food, and culture while celebrating India’s beautiful traditions. Book your tickets now and let’s make some memories!P.S. Perfect for young kids—fun, engaging, and unforgettableTerms and ConditionsThe management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. Paid valet parking available at Rs. 200 per car.Ticket holders grant organizers perpetual rights to use any recorded video or still footage of their appearance on any channel, without further approval.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Yin Yoga + Sound Bath
description: Come join us this Full Moon, for a yin yoga + sound bath experience.Deepika an experienced sound bath practitioner aims in blending creative expression and sound healing to manifest desires. Followed by a guided meditation and enhanced by the soothing tones of singing bowls. This deep relaxation and focus help you feel your dreams coming to life, fostering a powerful sense of connection to your goals. This session will also have a yin yoga practice, led by Julia, integrated into the sound healing session.What to bring:Yoga matSmall pillowBlindfold/ eye mask/ scarfWater bottle

name: End-of-Year Reflection
description: Reflecting on the year gone by!As we close out another year, this table invites you to pause and reflect on the moments that defined 2024.It's a space for sharing stories, celebrating achievements, acknowledging challenges and looking ahead for the new year.Let’s close the chapter of this year with gratitude and open the door to the possibilities of the new one.
